subject: Re: [junit] unit test metrics
msgSnippet: ... Tools you can use: - PMD (pmd.sf.net) to count the public non-test and test methods - jcoverage (jcoverage.com) for coverage of your tests (license is only
messageBody:
> I'm thinking of creating a script that will count all public non-test
> methods with more than 3 lines of code, and all test methods.

Tools you can use:

- PMD (pmd.sf.net) to count the public non-test and test methods
- jcoverage (jcoverage.com) for coverage of your tests (license is only
$98 iirc)

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Ritz Bossicard
www.bossicard.com
